summary: This document is a sealed grand jury subpoena and non-disclosure order issued to Microsoft Corporation by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. It commands Microsoft to produce all records for the email account 'jeffreyepstein@live.com' and prohibits Microsoft from notifying the subscriber about the subpoena for 365 days, citing risks to the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena to Microsoft Corporation as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Debra Freeman
persons.context: Signed the sealed non-disclosure order prohibiting Microsoft from notifying the subscriber about the subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena seeks all records for the email account 'jeffreyepstein@live.com', identifying him as the central subject of the criminal investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the grand jury investigation into Epstein, as evidenced by the subpoena for his email records.
Judge Freeman granted the government's (Berman's) application for a sealed non-disclosure order related to the Epstein subpoena.

events.title: Issuance of Sealed Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a sealed grand jury subpoena to Microsoft for records related to Jeffrey Epstein's email account.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance/Record Production
events.description: Microsoft was commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records by this date.

events.title: Court Issues Sealed Non-Disclosure Order
events.description: Magistrate Judge Debra Freeman issued a sealed order prohibiting Microsoft from notifying Epstein or anyone else about the subpoena for 365 days.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, New York
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was conducting a grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for suspected violations of federal sex trafficking laws (18 U.S.C. §§ 1591, 1594(c), 2422(b)).
The investigation sought comprehensive records for Epstein's Microsoft email account (jeffreyepstein@live.com), including subscriber info, session logs, payment methods, and correspondence.

A federal judge sealed the subpoena and issued a gag order, preventing Microsoft from notifying Epstein about the investigation for 365 days due to concerns about witness intimidation, evidence destruction, or flight risk.
The document is dated December 19, 2018, which is during the period of the Southern District of New York's investigation that ultimately led to Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
